Summary: Requires the State Air Resources Board
column3: to update the mobile source strategy to include a comprehensive strategy for the deployment of medium- and heavy-duty vehicles in the state for the purpose of bringing the state into compliance with federal ambient air quality standards and reducing motor vehicle greenhouse gas emissions from the medium- and heavy-duty vehicle sector. Requires the board to recommend reasonable and achievable goals for reducing emissions.

Water Conservation: Water Meters: Accuracy Standards

Summary: Requires the State Energy Resources Conservation and Development Commission to adopt regulations setting standards for the accuracy of water meters. Prohibits any water meter manufactured on or after the effective date of those regulations from being sold or offered for sale in the state
column2: or installed by a water purveyor
column3: unless it is certified by the manufacturer to be in compliance with those standards.

Fighting Climate Change and Conserving Biodiversity

column4: Wildlife-Pollinators

column2: in order to combat the biodiversity and climate crises
column3: to establish the California Biodiversity Collaborative to bring together other governmental partners
column4: Native American tribes
column5: experts
column6: business and community leaders and other stakeholders from across California to protect and restore the state's biodiversity. Provides that it is the goal of the state to conserve at least 30% of California's land and coastal waters by 2030.

Summary: Requires specified things of the State Coastal Conservancy when it allocates any funding appropriated pursuant to the Global Warming Solutions Act
column2: including that it prioritize projects that use natural infrastructure to help adapt to climate change. Requires the Conservancy to provide information to the Office of Planning and Research on any projects funded to be considered for inclusion into the clearinghouse for climate adaption information. Revises the definition of natural infrastructure.

Provides for revenue bonds.

Summary: Prohibits a transferor of water from using a water conveyance facility that has unused capacity to transfer water from a groundwater basin underlying desert lands that is in the vicinity of specified federal lands or state lands to outside of the groundwater basin
column2: unless the State Lands Commission finds no adverse affect to the natural or cultural resources of those federal or state lands. Requires a transferor of water to submit an application to the Commission.

Summary: Declares that the discharge of treated wastewater from ocean outfalls is a waste and unreasonable use of water. Requires each wastewater treatment facility that discharges through an ocean outfall and affiliated water suppliers to reduce the facility's annual flow as compared to the average annual dry weather wastewater discharge baseline volume. Provides a penalty for failing to submit a plan or report addressing the progress toward meeting the annual flow reduction deadlines.

Summary: Requires a state prosecutor to investigate incidents of an officer involved shooting resulting in the death of an unarmed civilian. Makes the Attorney General the state prosecutor unless otherwise specified or named. Authorizes the state prosecutor to prepare a written report and to post any reports made on a public internet website. Requires the Attorney General to operate a Police Practices Division to review the use of deadly force policies of a requesting law enforcement agency.

column3: to permit expedited treatment of health conditions during the COVID-19 pandemic

column6: medically necessary covered services and treatments to insureds under each policy.

column2: provides that in the event of an ethylene oxide leak
column3: a facility shall issue a notice with specified information immediately upon discovery to all affected property owners and local governments within a certain distance of the leak site
column4: applies to an owner or operator of a sterilization source using a certain amount of ethylene oxide
column5: provides persons and entities exempt from these provisions.

Summary: Establishes the Food Waste Grant Program to provide grants to county boards or public schools to reduce food waste during afterschool activities
column2: authorizes a county board of education or a public school to apply for a grant under the Program.

column1: 02/07/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on WAYS AND MEANS.
Summary: Requires the Office of Recycling in the Department of the Environment to develop markets for recycled materials and recycled products in the State in a certain manner
column2: requires the Office to report to the General Assembly each year
column3: requires the Office to coordinate certain activities with certain entities
column4: prohibits the Department of the Environment from employing more than a certain number of staff to carry out the requirements of the Act.

column1: 02/07/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on ENVIRONMENT AND TRANSPORTATION.
03/12/2020 - From HOUSE Committee on ENVIRONMENT AND TRANSPORTATION: Reported as amended.
03/12/2020 - Committee amendment adopted on HOUSE floor.
03/12/2020 - Second reading passed with amendments. To third reading.

Author: Lehman (D) Additional Authors: Acevero (D);Terrasa (D);Solomon (D);Qi (D);Love (D);Guyton (D);Charkoudian (D);Bridges (D);Boyce (D);Pena-Melnyk (D);Lewis R (D);Wilkins (D);Moon (D);Fraser-Hidalgo (D);Valentino-Smith (D);Cullison (D);Carr (D)

Summary: Requires a producer of synthetic turf and turf infill to individually or as part of a stewardship organization submit a synthetic turf and turf infill stewardship plan to the Department of the Environment for review and approval.
02/07/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on ECONOMIC MATTERS.
02/25/2020 - From HOUSE Committee on ECONOMIC MATTERS: Reported unfavorably.
Status: Failed - Adjourned - House Rules and Executive Nominations Committee
Summary: Establishes the Committee on Air Quality to create
column2: on or before a specified date
column3: an air quality sampling and monitoring protocol for the collection of air quality and public health data associated with certain large animal-feeding operations
column4: requires that the protocol establish the methodology for the Department of the Environment to use to quantify and assess certain data
column5: requires the Department to report its findings from certain assessments and evaluations to the Governor and the General Assembly.

column1: 02/24/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES AND EXECUTIVE NOMINATIONS.
Status: Failed - Adjourned - House Rules and Executive Nominations Committee
Summary: Requires the Department of the Environment
column2: in consultation with the Maryland Environmental Service
column3: to establish a grant program to assist counties with certain costs associated with the collection
column4: recycling
column5: and composting of organics and other compostable materials from residential properties
column6: specifies that sources of funding for the program consist of funds designated by the Department
column7: funds appropriated by the State Budget
column8: and any money made available from any public or private source.

column1: 02/26/2020 - To HOUSE Committee on RULES AND EXECUTIVE NOMINATIONS.
Associated Bills: MA H 3801 - New Text of;MA S 2235 - New Text see
Summary: Makes appropriations for the Fiscal Year 2020 for the maintenance of the departments
column4: institutions
column5: and certain activities of the Commonwealth
column6: for interest
column7: sinking fund
